snippet: A statement from the main rebel coalition appeared to drop a demand that President Bashar al-Assad step down before negotiations could begin.
abstract: Main Syrian exile opposition coalition yields to international pressure by dropping its refusal to hold peace talks with Pres Bashar al-Assad's government.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: A statement from the main rebel coalition appeared to drop a demand that President Bashar al-Assad step down before negotiations could begin.

headline.main: Leading Syrian Opposition Group, Yielding to Pressure, Votes to Join Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Leading Syrian Opposition Group, Yielding to Pressure, Votes to Join Peace Talks

keywords.value: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
